result.execSummary:
The defendant Brent A Buffington was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid at $50.00 per month commencing 04-01-2016 or serve 8 days jail consecutive as penalty for non payment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Brent A Buffington in court with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Defendant has completed up front treatment.  The State moves to amend count #1 to a county ordinance of disorderly conduct.  The Court amends the charge accordingly, enters a plea of no contest and finds the defendant guilty.  Counts #2 and #3 are dismissed and read in.  The Defendant is sentenced as follows:
Count #1:
FINE: $399.00 (Defendant to pay $50.00 per month commencing 4/1/16 or serve 8 days jail consecutive as penalty for non payment.

Defendant Brent A Buffington in court with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.  Lesli S Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.     Attorney Fragoso advises the Defendant is scheduled to complete  treatment on 2/25/16.   There is an offer to amend with completion of treatment. Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 4, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Prior: 4031 Stillwater Circle, Waukesha, WI 53189 United States

Defendant Brent A Buffington in court with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   State has offer to amend charge if defendant completes treatment. Defense advised the defendant enrolled in his class and the 1st one starts on October 20, 2015. Court will give another date in January.  Hearing scheduled for January 8, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Brent A Buffington in court with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense needs to start and complete classes. The classes are for 20 weeks. Court will give another date in mid-October.  Hearing scheduled for October 12, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Brent A Buffington in court with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   State has offer to amend charge if defendant completes counseling. Defense requests another date. Court grants request. Defense to advise on the next date how this matter is to be scheduled.  Hearing scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster.  Defendant is not to have any violent contact with witness listed in the criminal complaint.

Defendant Brent A Buffington in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for May 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
